resources.string: The alarm screams – it\'s 7:55. On the floor lies only one sock. The bed is a mess and somewhere a cat meows.
A narrow hallway with your uncle\'s portrait and a jacket on the hanger. A string lies on the floor.
A battlefield of toothpaste. The washing machine hums suspiciously and the laundry basket is empty.
The smell of coffee fills the air. On the counter lies a note from your wife and the apartment key.
Muro rules here. He sleeps on the couch, and a piece of fabric sticks out from underneath.
A small balcony with laundry hanging and a pigeon with artistic ambitions.
Beneath the couch you find a toy and a piece of fabric – apparently part of the missing sock.
Cica jumps out of the washing machine. She\'s holding a small key in her paws.
You returned to the bedroom and opened a locked cabinet. Inside is just a funny note.
You stand in the hallway with your jacket and key. In your sports bag, you find the second sock. You did it!
Your lucky sock with your favorite football team\'s logo.
The missing sock that caused all your problems.
A seemingly useless piece of string, but it might come in handy.
A metal key that finally lets you leave the flat.
A chewed fragment of your missing sock.
Cica dropped it after some negotiation. It fits a small cabinet.
Went to mom’s. You didn’t feed the cat! And don’t look for socks in the fridge.
A pigeon has artistically expressed itself on it.
A small paper card reading: “In your favorite sports bag!”
Your lazy, confident cat who believes he owns the flat.
A curious and slightly cunning cat who loves playing with socks.
A pigeon with the soul of an impressionist, who loves to leave his mark.
You see only one sock. Where could the other one be?
You picked up the string. It might come in handy later.
You hear a quiet meow from inside. Something’s in there!
"Went to mom’s. You didn’t feed the cat! And don’t look for socks in the fridge."
It’s too heavy. Maybe Muro would move if you feed him.
Muro happily rolls off the couch, revealing a dark hole underneath.
The pigeon flies away, but later returns to leave a gift on your jacket.
You picked up a piece of your missing sock.
Cica purrs contentedly and drops a small key.
You unlocked the cabinet. Inside is just a note.
Victory! You found the second sock and solved the Sock Paradox!
Congratulations, Fero! The Sock Paradox is solved!
